item.title: Pain(less?) NGINX Ingress
item.description: So you have a Kubernetes cluster and are using (or considering using) the NGINX ingress controller to forward outside traffic to in-cluster services. That’s awesome! The first time I looked at it, everything looked so easy; installing the NGINX ingress controller was one helm install away, so I did it. Then, after hooking up the DNS to the load balancer and creating a few Ingress resources, I was in business.
